title: Connectors
content:
The Integration Studio supports the following connectors. 

The following describes the supported actions and authentication method for each connector. 

Asana REST API

Authentication type: Bearer Token

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description
Get multiple workspaces Gets the compact records for all workspaces visible to the authorized user. This action will execute the following GET request: /api/$version/workspaces. 
Get workspace memberships Gets the compact workspace membership records for the workspace. This action will execute the following GET request: /api/$version/workspaces/$workspaceGid/workspace_memberships.

Atlassian Jira

Authentication type: Basic Authentication, OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code grant type

Supported actions: see the table below. 

The actions are based on v2 of the JIRA REST API. For details, refer to the Jira documentation.

Cloud Platform API actions

Supported actions
Action Description
Get comment Gets a comment of an issue as per ID.
Add attachment

Adds one single attachment.
Get comments

Gets the comments of an issue as per ID. 
Get issues

Searches for and returns one or more issues as per JIRA JQL.

Get issue

Gets issue details as per ID with the required fields. 
Create issue

Creates an issue.
Get user

Gets a user as per account ID. 
Update issue

Updates an issue.
Get attachment content

Gets attachment content as per attachment ID.
Add comment

Creates one single comment. 

Transition an issue

Performs an issue transition and, if the transition has a screen, updates the fields from the transition screen. To update the fields, specify the fields in the request body. This action executes the following POST request: /rest/api/2/issue/$IssueID/transitions.
Get account IDs for users Returns the account IDs for the users specified in the key or username parameters. Multiple key or username parameters can be specified. This action executes the following GET request: /rest/api/2/user/bulk/migration
Get all users Returns a list of all users, including active users, inactive users, and previously deleted users who have an Atlassian account. This action executes the following GET request: /rest/api/2/users
Find users Returns a list of active users that match the search string and property. This operation first applies a filter to match the search string and property, and then takes the filtered users in the range defined by startAt and maxResults, up to the thousandth user. To get all the users who match the search string and property, use Get all users and filter the records in your code. This action executes the following GET request: /rest/api/2/users/search

Service Management API actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Get customer requests

Returns all customer requests for the executed query. This action executes the following GET request: /rest/servicedeskapi/request
Get customer request by ID/key Returns a customer request. This action executes the following GET request: /rest/servicedeskapi/request/{issueIdOrKey}
Create customer request Creates a customer request in a service desk. The JSON request must include the service desk, the customer request type, as well as any fields that are required for the request type. This action executes the following POST request: /rest/servicedeskapi/request
Create request comment Creates a public or private (internal) comment on a customer request, with the comment visibility set by public. The action executes the following POST request: /rest/servicedeskapi/request/{issueIdOrKey}/comment
Get request comments Returns all comments on a customer request. This action executes the following GET request: /rest/servicedeskapi/request/${issueIdOrKey}/comment
Subscribe Subscribes the user to receiving notifications from a customer request. This action executes the following PUT request: /rest/servicedeskapi/request/${issueIdOrKey}/notification
Unsubscribe Unsubscribes the user from notifications from a customer request. The action executes the following DELETE request: /rest/servicedeskapi/request/${issueIdOrKey}/notification
Perform customer transition Performs a customer transition for a given request and transition. An optional comment can be included to provide a reason for the transition. This action executes the following POST request: /rest/servicedeskapi/request/${issueIdOrKey}/transition
Get request types Returns all customer request types from a service desk. This action executes the following GET request: /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/${serviceDeskId}/requesttype
Get customer transitions Returns the list of transitions that the user can perform on a request. Use this method to provide a user with a list if the actions they can take on a customer request. This action executes the following GET request: /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/${issueIdOrKey}/transition

AWS Management & Governance

Authentication type: AWS Signature

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description
Describe account

Retrieves AWS Organizations-related information about the specified account. Using this action will send a POST request to the address configured in the action's Host parameter, with the X-Amz-Target header: AWSOrganizationsV20161128.DescribeAccount.
Describe organization

Retrieves information about the organization that the user's account belongs to. Using this action will send a POST request to the address configured in the action's Host parameter, with the X-Amz-Target header: AWSOrganizationsV20161128.DescribeOrganization.
List accounts

Lists all the accounts in the organization. Using this action will send a POST request to the address configured in the action's Host parameter, with the X-Amz-Target header: AWSOrganizationsV20161128.ListAccounts.
List accounts for parent

Lists the accounts in an organization that is contained by the specified parent. Using this action will send a POST request to the address configured in the action's Host parameter, with the X-Amz-Target header: AWSOrganizationsV20161128.ListAccountsForParent.

Datadog API

Authentication type: No Auth

Supported actions: 

Downtime actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Cancel a downtime

Cancels a downtime. This endpoint requires the 'monitors_downtime' authorization scope. The action executes the following DELETE request: /api/<Version>/downtime/<downtime_id>.

Cancel a downtime by scope

Deletes all downtimes that match the scope of X. This endpoint requires the 'monitors_downtime' authorization scope. This action executes the following POST request: /api/<version>/downtime/cancel/by_scope.

Get a downtime

Gets the downtime detail by downtime_id. This endpoint requires the 'monitors_downtime' authorization scope. This action executes the following GET request: /api/<version>/downtime/<downtime_id>.

Get all downtimes

Gets all scheduled downtimes. This endpoint requires the 'monitors_downtime' authorization scope. This action executes the following REST call: /api/<version>/downtime.

Schedule a downtime

Schedules a downtime. This endpoint requires the 'monitors_downtime' authorization scope. This action executes the following POST request: /api/<version>/downtime.

Update a downtime

Updates a downtime identified by downtime_id. This endpoint requires the 'monitors_downtime' authorization scope. The action executes the following PATCH request: /api/<version>/downtime/<downtime_id>.

Event actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Get an event

Gets the event details. This endpoint requires the 'events_read' authorization scope. This action executes the following GET request: /api/<version>/events/<event_id>.

Host actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Get all hosts for your organization

Searches for hosts by name, alias, or tag. Hosts live within the past 3 hours are included by default. Retention is 7 days. Results are paginated with a max of 1000 results at a time. The action executes the following GET request: /api/<version>/hosts.

Mute a host

Mutes a host. Note: This creates a Downtime (V2) for the host. This action executes the following POST request: /api/<version>/host/<host_name>/mute.

Unmute a host

Unmutes a host. This endpoint takes no JSON arguments. The action executes the following POST request: /api/<version>/host/<host_name>/unmute.

Incident actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Create an incident

Creates an incident. This endpoint requires the 'incident_write' authorization scope. The action executes the following POST request: /api/<version>/incidents.

Get a list of incidents

Gets all incidents for the user’s organization. This endpoint requires the 'incident_read' authorization scope. This action executes the following GET request: /api/<version>/incidents.

Get the details of an incident

Gets the details of an incident by incident_id. This endpoint requires the 'incident_read' authorization scope. This action executes the following GET request: /api/<version>/incidents/<incident_id>.

Search for incidents

Searches for incidents matching a certain query. This endpoint requires the 'incident_read' authorization scope. The action executes the following GET request: /api/<version>/incidents/search.

Update an existing incident

Updates an incident. This endpoint requires the 'incident_write' authorization scope. This action executes the following PATCH request: /api/<version>/incidents/<incident_id>.

User actions

Supported actions
Action Description

List all users

Gets a list of users in the organization. This list includes all users even if they are deactivated or unverified. This endpoint requires the 'user_access_read' authorization scope. This action executes the following GET request: /api/<version>/users.

Generic

Unlike other connectors, which represent specific systems that can be integrated with Service Management, the Generic connector enables you to construct HTTP requests that can be sent to any system's REST endpoints. The actions that are included in this connector correspond to common HTTP request methods: GET, POST, DELETE, PATCH, PUT.

Supported authentication: Depends on the target system

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description
Send a DELETE request (JSON)

Sends a DELETE request to the endpoint, using the application/json content-type.
Send a GET request (JSON)

Sends a GET request to the endpoint, using the application/json content-type.

Send a GET request (binary data)

Sends a GET request to the endpoint using an empty content-type.

Note: To ensure Integration Studio treats the response data as an attachment, the target system must include the header Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="<file name>" in its response.
Send a PATCH request (JSON)

Sends a PATCH request to the endpoint with the specified payload, using the application/json content-type.
Send a POST request (JSON)

Sends a POST request to the endpoint with the specified payload, using the application/json content-type.

Send a POST request (multipart form)

Sends a POST request to the endpoint with the specified payload, using the multipart/form-data content-type.
Send a POST request (binary data)
Sends a POST request to the endpoint with the specified payload, using the application/octet-stream content type.
Send a PUT request (JSON)

Sends a PUT request to the endpoint with the specified payload, using the application/json content-type.

GitHub Actions REST API

Authentication type: Bearer Token

Supported actions: 

Workflow job actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Get a job for workflow run

Gets a specific job in a workflow run. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/jobs/{job_id}.

List jobs for a workflow run attempt

Lists jobs for a specific workflow run attempt. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}/attempts/{attempt_number}/jobs.

List jobs for a workflow run

Lists jobs for a specific workflow run. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}/jobs.

Workflow run actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Re-run a job from a workflow run

Re-runs a job and its dependent jobs in a workflow run. Using this action will execute the following POST request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/jobs/{job_id}/rerun.

List workflow runs for a repository

Lists all workflow runs for a repository. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs.

Get a workflow run

Gets a specific workflow run. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}.

Get the review history for a workflow run

Gets the review history for a workflow run. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}/approvals.

Approve a workflow run for a fork pull request

Approves a workflow run for a pull request from a public fork of a first-time contributor. Using this action will execute the following POST request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}/approve.

Get a workflow run attempt

Gets a specific workflow run attempt. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}/attempts/{attempt_number}.

Cancel a workflow run

Cancels a workflow run using its Id. Using this action will execute the following POST request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}/cancel.

Get pending deployments for a workflow run

Gets all deployment environments that are waiting for protection rules to pass. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}/pending_deployments.

Review pending deployments for a workflow run

Approves or rejects pending deployments that are waiting on approval by a required reviewer. Required reviewers with read access to the repository contents and deployments can use this endpoint. Using this action will execute the following POST request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}/pending_deployments.

Re-run a workflow

Re-runs your workflow run using its Id. Using this action will execute the following POST request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}/rerun.

Re-run failed jobs from a workflow run

Re-runs all of the failed jobs and their dependent jobs in a workflow run identified by the Id. Using this action will execute the following POST request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/runs/{run_id}/rerun-failed-jobs.

List workflow runs for a workflow

Lists all workflow runs for a workflow. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/workflows/{workflow_id}/runs.

Workflow actions

Supported actions
Action Description

List repository workflows

Lists the workflows in a repository. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/workflows.

Create a workflow dispatch event

Triggers a GitHub Actions workflow run. Using this action will execute the following POST request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/workflows/{workflow_id}/dispatches.

Get a workflow

Gets a specific workflow. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /repos/{owner}/{repo}/actions/workflows/{workflow_id}.

Gmail Connector API 

Authentication type: OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code grant type, OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials grant type

The Gmail Connector API is supported on versions 24.4.1 and above.

Supported actions:

Supported actions
Action Description Required OAuth Scopes
Get attachment Read an attachment that is attached to a message. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/{userId}/messages/{messageId}/attachments/{id}. 

https://mail.google.com/

or
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.modify
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly
Get message Retrieves the properties and relationships of a message object. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/{userid}/messages/$id. 

https://mail.google.com/

or
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.modify
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.metadata
Get message MIME content Retrieves the MIME content of a message. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/{userId}/messages/${id}?format=raw. 

https://mail.google.com/

or
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.modify
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.metadata

List messages

Lists the messages in the user's mailbox. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/{userId}/messages.


https://mail.google.com/

or
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.modify
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.metadat

List labels

Lists all labels in the user's mailbox. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/{userId}/labels

https://mail.google.com/

or
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.modify
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.labels
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.metadata

Watch mailbox

Set up or update a push notification watch on the given user mailbox. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/{userId}/watch. 

https://mail.google.com/

or
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.modify,
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly,
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.metadata
Modify message Modifies the labels on the specified message. This action will execute the following PATCH request: /$Version/users/{userId}/messages/{id}/modify. 

https://mail.google.com/

or
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.modify

Google Cloud Resource Manager API

Authentication type: OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code grant type

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description

Get organizations

Gets a list of organizations that the user who grants consent in the endpoint configuration has view permission. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /v3/organizations:search?pageToken=$pageToken&pageSize=$pageSize&query=$query.

Get projects

Gets a list of projects that the user who grants consent in the endpoint configuration has view permission. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /v1/projects?pageToken=$pageToken&pageSize=$pageSize.

Jenkins Remote Access API

Authentication type: Basic Authentication

Supported actions:

Supported actions
Action Description

Get builds

Gets one or more builds. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /$FOLDERPATH/job/$JOBNAME/$BUILD/api/json.

Trigger job

Triggers a job. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /$FOLDERPATH/job/$JOBNAME/buildWithParameters?$BUILDPARAMETERS.

Lucid SCIM API

Authentication type: Bearer Token

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description

Get all users

Gets all users on an account. This action will execute the following GET request: /scim/$version/Users.

Meta WhatsApp

Authentication type: Bearer Token

Supported actions:

Supported actions
Action Description

Send template message

Sends a message based on a predefined template. This action sends a POST request to: /${APIVersion}/${PHONE_NUMBER_ID}/messages

Microsoft Azure Billing

Authentication type: OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials grant type

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description

Get billing accounts

Lists all billing accounts that the user who grants consent in the endpoint configuration has view permission. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts?api-version=$api-version.

Get billing subscriptions

Lists all billing subscriptions that belong to the specified billing account. Using this action will execute the following GET request: /providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/$billingAccountName/billingSubscriptions?api-version=$api-version.

Microsoft Azure Bot Framework Connector API

Authentication type: OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials grant type

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description

Create conversation

Creates a new conversation. This action will execute the following POST request: /v3/conversations. 

Get conversation member

Gets details about a specific member of a specific conversation. This action will execute the following GET request: /v3/conversations/$conversationId/members/$memberId.

Get conversation members

Gets the members of the specified conversation. This action will execute the following GET request: /v3/conversations/$conversationId/members.

Reply to activity

Sends an activity (message) to the specified conversation, as a reply to the specified activity. This action will execute the following POST request: /v3/conversations/$conversationId/activities/$activityId.

Send to conversation

Sends an activity (message) to the specified conversation. This action will execute the following POST request: /v3/conversations/$conversationId/activities.

Update activity

Updates an existing activity to reflect the new state of a bot conversation. This action will execute the following PUT request: /v3/conversations/$conversationId/activities/$activityId.

Microsoft Azure DevOps

Authentication type: Basic Authentication

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description

Get Work Item

Returns a single work item. This action will execute the following GET request: /{organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/workitems/{id}?api-version=${apiVersion}&fields={fields}&asOf={asOf}&$expand={expand}

List Work Items

Returns a list of work items (Maximum 200). This action will execute the following GET request: /{organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/workitems?ids={ids}&fields={fields}&asOf={asOf}&$expand={expand}&errorPolicy={errorPolicy}&api-version={apiVersion}

Create Work Item

Creates a single work item. This action will execute the following POST request: /{organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/workitems/{type}?validateOnly={validateOnly}&bypassRules={bypassRules}&suppressNotifications={suppressNotifications}&$expand={expand}&api-version={apiVersion}

Update Work Item

Updates a single work item. This action will execute the following PATCH request: /{organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/workitems/{id}?validateOnly={validateOnly}&bypassRules={bypassRules}&suppressNotifications={suppressNotifications}&$expand={expand}&api-version={apiVersion}

Delete Work Item

Deletes the specified work item and sends it to the Recycle Bin, so that it can be restored back, if required. This action will execute the following DELETE request: /{organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/workitems/{id}?api-version={apiVersion}

Get comment

Returns a work item comment. The action will execute the following GET request: /{organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/workItems/{workItemId}/comments/{commentId}?$expand={$expand}&api-version={apiVersion}

Get comments

Returns a list of work item comments, pageable. The action will execute the following GET request: {organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/workItems/{workItemId}/comments?$expand={$expand}&api-version={apiVersion}&$top={top}&order={order}&continuationToken={continuationToken}

Add comment

Adds comment on a work item. The action will execute the following POST request: /{organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/workItems/{workItemId}/comments?api-version={apiVersion}

Query By Wiql

Gets the results of the query given its WIQL. This action will execute the following POST request: /{organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/wiql?timePrecision={timePrecision}&$top={top}&api-version={apiVersion}
Query by Query ID Gets the results of the query by using the query ID. The query is defined in Azure DevOps. This action will execute the following GET request: /{organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/wiql/{queryid}?timePrecision={timePrecision}&$top={top}&api-version={apiVersion}
Upload attachment Adds a single attachment to the record. The action will execute the following POST request: /{organization}/{project}/_apis/wit/attachments?areaPath={areaPath}&api-version={apiVersion}

Microsoft Graph

Authentication type: OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code grant type, OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials grant type

Supported actions:

General / Group actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Create group

Creates a new group as specified in the request body. You can create the following types of groups:  Microsoft 365 group (unified group), Security group. This action will execute the following POST request /$Version/groups. The API requires the following permissions: Group.Create, Group.ReadWrite.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All, User.Read.All, Application.Read.All.

Get group

Gets the properties and relationships of a group object. This action will execute the following GET request: /${version}/groups/$Id. This API requires one of the following permissions: GroupMember.Read.All, Group.Read.All, Directory.Read.All, Group.ReadWrite.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All.

Get list of groups

Lists all the groups available in an organization, excluding dynamic distribution groups. This action will execute the following GET request: /${version}/groups. This API requires one of the following permissions: GroupMember.Read.All, Group.Read.All, Directory.Read.All
Get list of groups (delta) Lists all the groups available in an organization, excluding dynamic distribution groups. This action will execute the following GET request: /${version}/groups/delta. This API requires one of the following permissions: GroupMember.Read.All, Group.Read.All, Directory.Read.All

Update group

Updates the properties of a group object. This action will execute the following PATCH request: /$version/$groups/$id. The API requires the following permissions: Group.ReadWrite.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All.

General/ Mail actions

Supported actions
Action Description
Copy messaage Copy a message to another folder within the user's mailbox. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/users/$userid/messages/$id/copy. This API requires the Mail.ReadWrite application or delegated permission.
Get attachment Read an attachment that is attached to a message. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/$userid/messages/$messageId/attachments/$id. This API requires the Mail.Read application or delegated permission.
Get message Retrieves the properties and relationships of a message object. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/$userid/messages/$id. This API requires the Mail.Read application or delegated permission.
Get MIME content Retrieves the MIME content of a message. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/$userid/messages/$id/$value. This API requires the Mail.Read application or delegated permission.

List messages

Gets the messages in the signed-in user's mailbox (including the Deleted Items and Clutter folders). This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/me/messages. This API requires the Mail.Read delegated permission.

List messages in folder

Gets all the messages in the signed-in user's mailbox, or those messages in a specified folder in the mailbox. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/me/mailFolders/$folderid/messages. This API requires the Mail.Read delegated permission.
List attachment Ids Retrieve a list of attachment Id attached to a message. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/$userid/messages/$messageId/attachments?$select=id,isInline,name. This API requires the Mail.Read application or delegated permission.

List attachments

Retrieves a list of attachment objects attached to a message of the signed-in user. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/me/messages/$messageId/attachments. This API requires the Mail.Read delegated permission.

List mail folders

Gets the mail folder collection directly under the root folder of the signed-in user. The returned collection includes any mail search folders directly under the root. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/me/mailFolders. This API requires the Mail.Read delegated permission.

Move message

Moves a message to another folder within the signed-in user's mailbox. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/me/messages/$id/move. This API requires the Mail.ReadWrite delegated permission.

Send mail

Sends the message specified in the request body using JSON. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/$userid/sendMail. This API requires the Mail.Send application permission.
Update message Updates the properties of a message object. This action will execute the following PATCH request: /$Version/me/messages/$id. This API requires the Mail.ReadWrite delegated permission.

General/ User actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Create user

Creates a user in the active directory. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/users. This API requires one of the following permissions: User.Read, User.ReadWrite, User.ReadBasic.All, User.Read.All, User.ReadWrite.All, Directory.Read.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All.

Execute action

Executes a Directory Object action against a user. This action will execute the following POST request: /$version/$users/$id/$action. Example actions: assignLicense, getMemberGroups, checkMemberGroups, licenseDetails, revokeSignInSessions etc. The APIs required are dependent on the executed action. For details, check the Microsoft Graph documentation.

Get list of users

Retrieves a list of users. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users. This API requires one of the following permissions: User.Read, User.ReadBasic.All, User.Read.All,  Directory.Read.All
Get list of users (delta) Retrieves a list of users. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/delta. This API requires one of the following permissions: User.Read, User.ReadBasic.All, User.Read.All,  Directory.Read.All

Get signed-in user

Retrieves the properties and relationships of the signed-in user. This is the user that you used to authenticate with Azure during the integration's endpoint configuration. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/me. This API requires one of the following permissions: User.Read, User.ReadWrite, User.ReadBasic.All, User.Read.All, User.ReadWrite.All, Directory.Read.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All.

Get user

Retrieves the properties and relationships of a user. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/$Id. This API requires one of the following permissions: User.Read, User.ReadWrite, User.ReadBasic.All, User.Read.All, User.ReadWrite.All, Directory.Read.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All.

List apps

Retrieves the list of apps installed in the personal scope of the specified user. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/$userid/teamwork/installedApps. This API requires one of the following permissions: TeamsAppInstallation.ReadForUser.All, TeamsAppInstallation.ReadWriteSelfForUser.All, TeamsAppInstallation.ReadWriteForUser.All.

List chats

Retrieves the list of chats that the user is part of. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/users/$userid/chats. This API requires one of the following permissions: Chat.ReadBasic.All*, Chat.Read.All*, Chat.ReadWrite.All*.

List license details

Retrieves the list of licenses that a user has acquired. This action will execute the following GET request: /$version/users/{id}/licenseDetails. This API requires one of the following permissions: User.Read, User.Read.All, User.ReadWrite.All, Directory.Read.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All.

Update user

Updates a user in the active directory. This action will execute the following PATCH request: /$Version/users/$Id. This API requires one of the following permissions: User.Read, User.ReadWrite, User.ReadBasic.All, User.Read.All, User.ReadWrite.All, Directory.Read.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All.

Identity and access / Subscribed SKU actions

Supported actions
Action Description
List Subscribed SKUs

Gets the list of commercial subscriptions that an organization has acquired. This action will execute the following GET request: /$version/subscribedSkus. This API requires one of the following permissions: Organization.Read.All, Directory.Read.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All, Organization.Read.All, Directory.Read.All, Organization.ReadWrite.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All.

Intune / Device Management actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Execute action

Runs an Intune action to manage the device. The action will execute the following POST request: /$version/deviceManagement/managedDevices/$Id/$ActionName.

This API requires the following permissions:

Delegated (work or school account): DeviceManagementManagedDevices.PrivilegedOperations.All

Application: DeviceManagementManagedDevices.PrivilegedOperations.All
Get all devices

Retrieves all devices managed in Intune. The action will execute the following GET request: /$version/deviceManagement/managedDevices?format=json.

The API requires the following permissions:

Delegated: DeviceManagementManagedDevices.Read.All, DeviceManagementManagedDevices.ReadWrite.All

Application: DeviceManagementManagedDevices.Read.All, DeviceManagementManagedDevices.ReadWrite.All.

Get device details

Retrieves the properties and relationships of the managedDevice object. This action will execute the following GET request: /$version/deviceManagement/manageddevices/$Id?format=json.

The API requires the following permissions:

Delegated: DeviceManagementManagedDevices.Read.All, DeviceManagementManagedDevices.ReadWrite.All

Application: DeviceManagementManagedDevices.Read.All, DeviceManagementManagedDevices.ReadWrite.All

Teams / Change notifications actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Create subscription

Subscribes a listener application to receive change notifications when the requested type of changes occur to the specified resource in Microsoft Graph. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/subscriptions.

Subscriptions expire after a length of time that varies by resource type. In order to avoid missing change notifications, an app should renew its subscriptions well in advance of their expiry date. See the Microsoft Graph documentation for the maximum length of a subscription for each resource type. Creating a subscription requires read scope to the resource. For example, to get change notifications on messages, your app needs the Mail.Read permission. For more details, check the Microsoft Graph REST API documentation.

Get subscription

Retrieves the properties and relationships of a subscription. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/subscriptions/$SubscriptionId. Depending on the resource and the permission type (delegated or application) requested, different permissions are required. For more details, check the Microsoft Graph REST API documentation.

Update subscription

Renews a subscription by extending its expiry time. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/subscriptions/$SubscriptionId. Depending on the resource and the permission type (delegated or application) requested, different permissions are required. For more details, check the Microsoft Graph REST API documentation.

Teams / Channel actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Get message

Retrieves a single message in a channel. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/teams/$TeamId/channels/$ChannelId/messages/$MessageId. This API requires one of the following permissions: ChannelMessage.Read.All, Group.Read.All**, Group.ReadWrite.All**

Get message reply

Retrieves a message reply in a channel. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/teams/$TeamId/channels/$ChannelId/messages/$MessageId/replies/$ReplyId. This API requires one of the following permissions: ChannelMessage.Read.All, Group.Read.All**, Group.ReadWrite.All**

List channels

Retrieves the list of channels in the specified team. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/teams/$TeamId/channels. This API requires one of the following permissions: Channel.ReadBasic.All, ChannelSettings.Read.All, ChannelSettings.ReadWrite.All, Group.Read.All**, Group.ReadWrite.All**, Directory.Read.All**, Directory.ReadWrite.All**

List messages

Retrieves the list of messages (without the replies) in a channel of a team. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/teams/$TeamId/channels/$ChannelId/messages/delta. This API requires this permission: ChannelMessage.Read.All.

Reply to message

Sends a new reply to a message in the specified channel. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/teams/$TeamId/channels/$ChannelId/messages/$MessageId/replies. This API requires one of the following permissions: ChannelMessage.Send, Group.ReadWrite.All**.

Send message

Sends a new message in the specified channel of a team. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/teams/$TeamId/channels/$ChannelId/messages. This API requires this permission: ChannelMessage.Send.

Update message

Updates a message in the specified channel of a team. This action will execute the following PATCH request: /$Version/teams/$TeamId/channels/$ChannelId/messages/$MessageId. This API requires this permission: Chat.ReadWrite.

Update reply to message

Updates a reply to a message in the specified channel. This action will execute the following PATCH request: /$Version/teams/$TeamId/channels/$ChannelId/messages/$MessageId/replies/$ReplyId. This API requires this permission: Chat.ReadWrite.

Teams / Chat actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Add member

Adds a member to a chat. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/chats/$ChatId/members. This API requires one of the following permissions: ChatMember.ReadWrite, Chat.ReadWrite.

Create group chat

Creates a group chat by using the specified user as the owner. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/chats. This API requires one of the following permissions: Chat.Create, Chat.ReadWrite.
Get chat

Retrieves a single chat (without its messages). This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/chats/$ChatId. This API requires one of the following permissions: Chat.ReadBasic, Chat.Read, Chat.ReadWrite.

Get message

Retrieves a single message in a chat. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/chats/$ChatId/messages/$MessageId. This API requires one of the following permissions: Chat.Read, Chat.ReadWrite.

List messages

Retrieves the list of messages (without the replies) in a chat. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/$ChatId/messages. This API requires one of the following permissions: Chat.Read, Chat.ReadWrite.

Send message

Sends a new message in the specified chat. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/chats/$ChatId/messages. This API requires one of the following permissions: ChatMessage.Send, Chat.ReadWrite.

Update message

Updates a message in the specified chat. This action will execute the following PATCH request: /$Version/chats/$ChatId/messages/$MessageId. This API requires this permission: Chat.ReadWrite.
Update chat

Updates a chat. This action will execute the following POST request: /$Version/chats/$ChatId. This API requires this permission: Chat.ReadWrite.

Teams / Team actions

Supported actions
Action Description

List your teams

Gets the teams in Microsoft Teams that the user is a direct member of. The user is who logged in to get token for Authorization Code grant type when configuring the integration's endpoint. This action will execute the following GET request: /$Version/me/joinedTeams.

Action Description

OpenText ALM Octane

Authentication type: Generic Authentication

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description
Create comment

Creates a comment in ALM Octane. The parameters follow the specifications of the ALM Octane REST API. This action will execute the following POST request: /api/shared_spaces/${Sharedspace}/workspaces/${Workspace}/comments.
Get comments

Gets a comment in ALM Octane. The parameters follow the specifications of the ALM Octane REST API. This action will execute the following GET request: /api/shared_spaces/${Sharedspace}/workspaces/${Workspace}/comments?query='owner_work_item EQ {id EQ ^${Workitem}^}'.
Get record(s)

Queries one or more records in ALM Octane. The parameters follow the specifications of the ALM Octane REST API. This action will execute the following GET request: /api/shared_spaces/${Sharedspace}/workspaces/${Workspace}/${Entity}?${QueryParameters}.
Create record

Creates a record in ALM Octane. The parameters follow the specifications of the ALM Octane REST API. This action will execute the following POST request: /api/shared_spaces/${Sharedspace}/workspaces/${Workspace}/${Entity}?${Fields}.
Update record

Updates a record in ALM Octane. The parameters follow the specifications of the ALM Octane REST API. This action will execute the following PUT request: /api/shared_spaces/${Sharedspace}/workspaces/${Workspace}/${Entity}/${Id}?${Fields}.

Create attachment

Creates a multipart file attachment. Using this action executes the following POST request: /api/shared_spaces/$Sharedspace/workspaces/$Workspace/attachments.

The action does not accept any query parameters. You must specify the entity key in the Text parameter section. The attachment must have an owner, and you specify the owner by using an owner field such as owner_work_item or owner_test. For example, '{"name":"test.png","owner_work_item":{"type":"work_item","id":"1002"}}'. Put the content key in the File parameter section.

For details, please check the Octane documentation.

Read attachment

Returns the binary attachment with the specified attachment id. Using this action executes the following GET request: /api/shared_spaces/$Sharedspace/workspaces/$Workspace/attachments/$AttachmentID.

For details, please check the Octane documentation.

OpenText Operations Orchestration

Authentication type: Generic Authentication

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description
Change the status of an execution

Updates existing execution statuses.

Each request has a single action and data but can be applied to multiple executions.

Changing the run status is allowed when the following conditions are true:

  • The user has the Run permission (entitlement) for the executed flow.
  • The run is currently assigned to the user, or alternatively, the user has the Manage Others' Runs permission.

You cannot change the status of a completed execution. You cannot change the status of an execution to the same status.

Using this action will execute the following PUT request: /oo/rest/${Version}/executions/{executionIds}/status
Execute a flow by UUID

Starts a flow by its UUID in Operations Orchestration. The flow input parameter depends on the selected flow.

Using this action will execute the following POST request: /oo/rest/${Version}/executions

For how to use this action to run an Operations Orchestration flow, see this page.
Get execution log

Retrieves the extended summary of a specific execution. It is an extension of the Execution Summary API and holds additional information, such as the inputs and outputs of that execution.

Using this action will execute the following GET request: /oo/rest/${Version}/executions/${executionId}/execution-log

Creates a record in Quality Center. The parameters follow the specifications of the Quality Center REST API. Using this action will execute the following POST request: /rest/domains/${Domain}/projects/${Project}/${Entity}.

OpenText Service Management

Authentication type: Service Management

Supported actions: 

Case Exchange API actions

Supported actions
Action Description
Get attachment Gets an attachment by specifying an FRS id.

Upload attachment

Uploads a multipart file attachment. The multipart POST method does not accept any query parameters. You must specify the files[] key in the File parameter section.
Manage record

Creates, updates, or resolves records by using the Service Management CES API. Supported record types are Change, Incident, Problem, and Request.

Example: Create, update, and resolve records in the target system with the advanced functions provided by the CES API. 

Cloud Service API actions

Supported actions
Action Description
Manage cloud service data Creates or updates multiple cloud service data. Maximum 50 records in a call. Using this action will execute a POST request against the API: /rest/<TenantId>/cloud-service/syncData.

Comments API actions

Supported actions
Action Description
Create comment

Creates one single comment by using the Comments API. 

Example: Create a standalone comment without updating other properties of a record. 

EMS API actions

Supported actions
Action Description
Get associations

Queries the related records of a record. The association name represents the name of the Many2Many relationship in Service Management. The Filters and Layout parameters work in a similar way as those in other Service Management APIs.

Example: You can use this action to get related records such as related Devices to get details from the related records and use the data in the scenario.
Get record Queries record(s) in Service Management. The parameters follow the specifications of the EMS API.
Get record key

Verifies if a record exists, and returns the record ID if the record is found.

Example: Search for a record in the target system based on a value from the source system such as External Reference Number. 

Manage record (single)

Creates or updates records using the EMS API from Service Management. 

Example: Create and update records of any record type in Service Management. 
Manage record (bulk) Creates or updates records in bulk using the EMS API from Service Management.

Manage relationship (single)

Creates or deletes relationships using the EMS API from Service Management.

Example: Add a related CI to an Incident.
Manage relationship (bulk) Creates or deletes relationship in bulk using the EMS API from Service Management.

Manage Persons API actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Create or update persons (single (v1))

Creates or updates person records by using the Manage Persons API from Service Management.

The action enables you to specify only one role and one functional group.

Create or update persons (single (v2))

Creates or updates person records by using the Manage Persons API from Service Management. 

This action allows you to specify several roles, functional groups, and licenses.
Create or update persons (bulk)

Creates, updates, or deletes person records in bulk using the Manage Persons API from Service Management. At maximum 50 records are allowed in one bulk operation.

This action allows you to specify several roles, functional groups, and licenses.
Get job status for Manage Persons Gets the status of the job associated with the Manage Persons action that you executed previously. Using this action will execute a GET request against this API: /rest/<TenantId>/ums/managePersonsJobStatus/$JOBID. Please refer to the Manage Persons API specifications in the documentation.

Impersonation API actions

Supported actions
Action Description

Create comment

Creates a comment by impersonating the end user. Please refer to the comments API specifications in the documentation. Using this action will execute a POST request against the comments API: /rest/<TenantId>/ess/impersonation/Request/$EntityId/addComments?impersonate=<User Id>. 

Create request

Creates a request by impersonating the end user. The integration user needs to have the OPB/Integration Administrator permission to impersonate the end user. Using this action will execute a POST request against the EMS API: /rest/<TenantId>/ess/impersonation/createRequest?impersonate=<User Id>. 
Note: If you don't add RequestBy or RequestFor property for the request, then the impersonate user will be set as the RequestBy or RequestFor person.

Perform IDOL search

Returns results from an IDOL search by impersonating the end user. 

Perform User action

Performs a user action by impersonating the end user. Using this action will execute a POST request against the EMS API: /rest/<TenantId>/ess/impersonation/userAction?impersonate=<User Id>.

SAP SuccessFactors

Authentication type: Basic Authentication

Supported actions: see the table below. Currently, we support only v2 of the SAP SuccessFactors OData API.

Supported actions
Action Description

Query records (v2) - GET

Gets data from any entity. The action executes a GET request against the OData API: /odata/v2/$entity.

Insert operation (v2) - POST

Creates a record by using the HTTP POST method. The action executes a POST request against the OData API: /odata/v2/$entity.

Merge operation (v2) - POST

In certain cases, you might want to do an incremental update without replacing all the content of a data entity. A merge request updates only the properties provided in the request body (via the POST HTTP method), and leaves the data not mentioned in the request body in its current state. The action executes a POST request, with header x-http-method: MERGE, against the OData API: /odata/v2/$entity.

Replace operation (v2) - PUT

Updates an existing record with the fields specified in the request payload and resets all other fields to their default value. In a replace request, identify the record to be updated by passing the key predicate in the request URI. Unlike the merge operation, you must provide all required fields in the request payload.

The replace request returns status 204 (No Content) to indicate success. No response body is returned. The action executes a PUT request against the OData API: /odata/v2/$entity.

Upsert operation (v2) - POST

Updates or inserts records depending on whether the record already exists. If the record specified in payload doesn't exist, the system inserts (creates) a new record; if the record exists, the system updates the record. You can use upsert to batch insert/update and inline-edit records. The action executes a POST request against the OData API: /odata/v2/upsert.

Delete operation (v2) - DELETE

Deletes a record. Specify the record to be deleted by passing the key predicate in the request URI. The action executes a DELETE request against the OData API: /odata/v2/$entity(key).

SCIM

SCIM (System for Cross-domain Identity Management) connectors are used to manage user identities across applications that support the SCIM standard.

Supported actions
Action Description

This action executes a GET request /$version/$resource against the endpoint.

This action executes a GET request /$version/$resource/$id against the endpoint.

Create resource

This action executes a POST request /$version/$resource/$id against the endpoint.

Update resource

This action executes a PATCh request /$version/$resource/$id against the endpoint.

Replace resource

This action executes a PUT request /$version/$resource/$id against the endpoint.

Delete resource

This action executes a DELETE request /$version/$resource/$id against the endpoint.

Bulk operations

The body of a bulk operation contains a set of HTTP resource operations using one of the HTTP methods POST, PUT, PATCH or DELETE supported by the API.

Webex REST API

Authentication type: OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code grant type

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description
Get license details Gets the details for the specified license. Use the optional query parameter includeAssignedTo to get a list of all objects that are assigned with the license. This action will execute the following GET request: /$version/licenses/$licenseId. 
List licenses Lists all licenses for a given organization. If no orgId is specified, the default is the organization of the authenticated user. This action will execute the following GET request: /$version/licenses. 

Workday REST Services

Authentication type: Generic Authentication

Supported actions: 

Supported actions
Action Description

Get record(s)

Gets a list of records or a single record from a Workday endpoint according to the Workday REST API. This action will execute the following GET request: /api/$Service/$version/$Tenant/$Endpoint?$QueryParameters
